message.content: How can we make ourselves a sudoer for pkill and any other related commands?

content.text: You can add specific sudo rules without password for camera-related commands. Create a sudoers rule:

input.command: echo "$(whoami) ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/pkill cameracaptured, /usr/bin/pkill -f camera, /usr/bin/killall cameracaptured" | sudo tee /etc/sudoers.d/camera-control
input.description: Create sudoers rule for camera control commands

content.content:
sudo: a terminal is required to read the password; either use the -S option to read from standard input or configure an askpass helper
sudo: a password is required

toolUseResult:
Error: sudo: a terminal is required to read the password; either use the -S option to read from standard input or configure an askpass helper
sudo: a password is required

content.text:
You'll need to run this manually in Terminal with password. Alternative: check if camera permissions can be managed through System Preferences > Security & Privacy > Camera, or try running the PTZ tool with `sudo` when needed.

For now, try manually in Terminal:
```bash
sudo pkill cameracaptured
```

Then test PTZ camera again.

message.content: please write the full command to a file called 'run as root'

input.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Commands to run as root for PTZ camera access

# Kill cameracaptured process to free camera
sudo pkill cameracaptured

# Create sudoers rule for camera control (run once)
echo "$(whoami) ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/pkill cameracaptured, /usr/bin/pkill -f camera, /usr/bin/killall cameracaptured" | sudo tee /etc/sudoers.d/camera-control

# Test PTZ camera
./webcam-ptz pan middle

toolUseResult.content:
#!/bin/bash
# Commands to run as root for PTZ camera access

# Kill cameracaptured process to free camera
sudo pkill cameracaptured

# Create sudoers rule for camera control (run once)
echo "$(whoami) ALL=(ALL) NOPASSWD: /usr/bin/pkill cameracaptured, /usr/bin/pkill -f camera, /usr/bin/killall cameracaptured" | sudo tee /etc/sudoers.d/camera-control

# Test PTZ camera
./webcam-ptz pan middle

content.text: Created `run-as-root` script. Run it in Terminal to set up camera permissions and test PTZ.
